Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place!”
Reviews.Author: edewar
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with our stay at Inn Spagna. Nestled between numerous high end shops including Dior and Bvlgari, and only a two minute walk to the Spanish steps made for an amazing location. Although the room was small, we could not fault the cleanliness and staff. Looking out the window onto the cobbled streets of Rome ensured you don't stay long in your room anyway! Metro very close by, along with some great restaurants and shopping. Only negative was having to sit on the staircase to use the WiFi. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Less than 2 minutes walk to Spanish steps and Metro Station”
Reviews.Author: SAlidily
Reviews.Content: Location was amazing... Very close Spanish steps , beautiful shopping area, all brands (LV , D&G , Gucci ... ) Staff were friendly , helpful ,, The owner was nice , he helped us a lot while staying in inn Spagnya.. The night shift front desk was really helpful and always ready to answer questions and give advices where to go and how to get there... If it's your first time to Rome it's very easy to find your hotel, you will never get lost ;) Big supermarket just 5 minutes walking from the hotel Metro (Spagnya station ) less than 3 minutes from hotel, where you can get to all Rome nice and famous places. Fountain di trevi 10 minutes walking the hotel is standard, standard room, standard breakfast. No elevator (4th floor is not easy)! No Internet in the rooms... Ask to change the bed sheet if you feel it's not clean, they will change it :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ioanaL
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights, everything was just perfect, the location, the staff, everything... I would definitely come back and of course recommended to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Piu bello!:)”
Reviews.Author: Maria G
Reviews.Content: I visit this hotel and it was very nice. People are friendly and the place is amazing.The view was pretty nice and we appreciate that the rooms were clean. We really had a great vacation and we were pleased about spending quality time. For sure I will be back again. Thank you guys and see you next time!

Reviews.Title: “Worse than horrifying”
Reviews.Author: JSB10210
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so poor that my husband and I called our travel agent as soon as we saw the room and asked to be moved. We were booked in a standard double room, which, from their website, looks delightful! Gross misrepresentation of their rooms, our room was filthy with excessively chipping paint on the ceiling about the shower (see photo), large dust balls hanging from the bathroom fan, mold behind the bathroom sink, a toilet paper holder that was barely connected to the wall and kept dropping the toilet paper, water damage near the window, cigarette burns in the comforter which also appeared as though it had been dragged in the street for how much dirt was apparently ground into the fabric, and a mini-fridge with food particles and sticky liquid remnants! This room was on the second floor. When they showed us a room on the third floor, it was better, but still had cigarette ashes on the window sill (we had booked a non-smoking room), cracking paint and a rusty shower door. I would absolutely not recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed & where we needed it to be.”
Reviews.Author: MikePax
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Inn Spagna with our daughter and it was fantastic. Sure their is no lift but suck it up and enjoy the exercise, seriously. Location couldn't be better, right in the middle of where you want to be. Staff were really helpful even went as far as to secure a cab for us and explain to the driver where we needed to go. Rooms were just what we needed, clean and somewhere to recharge before to took on the city again. Will stay there again in a heartbeat! Thanks you.

Reviews.Title: “Very tiny... good service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: bmbtaylor
Reviews.Content: We have read other reviews that the rooms are tiny! And they are tiiiiinnnnnyyyy! Super Tiny! However where we were located, it was unbeatable! We had Gucci right out the front of the hotel, The Spanish Steps literally about a minute's stroll away... and the entire shopping strip at our doorstep! Great if you love shopping and being in the middle of it all. Service from the staff was good.

Reviews.Title: “One of the friendliest hotels I have stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: JulieJ48
Reviews.Content: The hotel does not stand out in the street, it is a doorway between Pucci and Dior but is worth finding. I arrived a couple of hours early and asked if I could leave my bag at reception. I have found at most larger hotels they will take bags but it is not possible to have a room until their check-in time. I was pleasantly surprised to be told there was a room ready so I was able to go off sightseeing without having to worry about going back to check in. The room was comfortable and clean. The hotel is small. It does not have a lift, bar or restaurant but what it lacks in those amenities it more than makes up for with the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. The location is wonderful, close to the Spanish Steps, the metro and streets full of bars and restaurants. On the morning I left, the hotel had booked a taxi for 8am. I went down about 7.45am and checked out. I was asked if I had eaten breakfast and I pointed out breakfast was not until 8am so I would get something at the airport. I was told that the waitress was in the breakfast room and I was welcome to have something to eat and I would be called when the taxi arrived. My stay at the Inn Spagna Room Hotel was a pleasant relaxing experience and I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but good location”
Reviews.Author: Caligirl78
Reviews.Content: *The Good, The Bad , and the Ugly* The receptionists working there are very helpful and nice Good water preassure Comfortable and clean bed Two blocks from Metro and taxi station In the heart of the fashion district Good continental breakfast Excellent Location *The Bad* The shower is tiny No lift Blow dryer did not work *The Ugly* TOO NOISY! and I mean it! Even if you close the windows it does not help. Not worth it for price

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as described”
Reviews.Author: fathenry
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellently situated as most of Rome is within walking distance. The stairs are not for the faint hearted as there is no lift. This is not the Hilton and there are no public rooms but there are enough good eateries and bars nearby. The rooms are modern and clean, the size is small but this is represented in the price. Breakfast is continental and plentiful. The staff were incredibly helpful and most spoke good English. We have stayed in many capital cities and this was great bearing in mind location/price/age of the building/season.

Reviews.Title: “Rome ???”
Reviews.Author: Il0veItaly
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel just for the location. OK, Eater in Rome is not the best time to go. People everywhere, stores all closed..etc. This is not a hotel, it's a apartment with small rooms with small bathroom just with shower you can't even move to shampoo your hair. We were given a room on the 4th floor, no elevator. At the middle of the night we realized there was no toilet paper. Heating was uncontrollable, it was like sleeping in the Amazon ! Just stay away !!! I warn you...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good price, but...”
Reviews.Author: M&J_BR
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through GHRS and paid 120 EUR/night (17 to 20/feb). The hotel is in an awesome location, 100 m from Piazza di Spagna, 50 m from Via Condotti and a short walk from the Parthenon. It's a great (and safe) neibourhough for a night stroll. The room (n. 404) and the bathroom was pretty clean and well kept. The breakfast was OK (Italian stile). There are two down parts: - First, while the hotel dosn't have a lobby, just a small front desk in the ground floor, the rooms are located in the 2nd, 3rd and 4th floors, with no elevator. You will have to carry up your luggages (I had help from the hotel manager). - And second is the size of the room and the shower. The room was so small we had problems to keep our stuf organized and the shower is so tide, you can avoid messing up. It's a good choice for those who doesn't care about stairs and the size of the room and are in search for a clean and well located place to stay. Afterall, if they had big rooms and elevator in that location, they would be charging 300 EUR. Conclusion: I would stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Inn Spagna Room Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Mario de' fiori 11, 00187 Rome, Italy
